docs.lead_paragraph: WHEN Jason came home and announced he had made the football team at Ossining High School, there was special cause for celebration. Home to Jason is the Asthmatic Children's Foundation of New York, a nonprofit residential treatment center in Ossining for severely asthmatic children. Drawn from all over the New York City area and from as far away as Florida, the 36 children at the center range in age from 5 to 15 years. Most have never been on a team, and most have spent as much time in hospitals as they have at school.
